meanings.definition: The act of inflating something excessively.
meanings.sent1: The overinflations of the balloons made them pop quickly.
meanings.sent2: The overinflations of the tires caused them to burst on the hot road.
meanings.sent3: The clown's overinflations of the balloons led to a hilarious scene at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her overinflations of the story made it seem more dramatic than it actually was.
meanings.sent5: The overinflations of the bubble gum made it impossible to chew.

meanings.definition: The state of being inflated beyond normal levels.
meanings.sent1: The overinflations of the prices left many people unable to afford basic goods.
meanings.sent2: The balloon's overinflations caused it to float higher than the others.
meanings.sent3: The overinflations of the beach ball made it bounce unpredictably in the wind.
meanings.sent4: The overinflations of his ego were evident in his arrogant behavior.
meanings.sent5: The overinflations of the balloon made it a striking sight against the clear sky.
